content.description:
P1- (5.11) Start at small ledge at the base of the dike.  Clip a bolt and climb up to a small bulge.  Move up a left staying on the dike much of the time.  Continue to a rounded roof (crux).  Clip the bolt and harness you inner Sporto to pull the roof.  Continue to the next roof, exit to the left side and up to another bolt placed in a grainy vertical slab.  Move up and right to the thank-God jug and on to the belay station. Pro is sparse but is there.

P2- (5.5) Continue up the blocky dike to the chains at the top. Pro is minimal but the climbing is easy. Beware of loose blocks on this pitch. Rap the route with 2 60m ropes.
content.location: Located on the right side of the wall at the base of the obvious vertical dike (very unique to the Fords)
This climb starts directly below the double roofs on the large ledge system on the left side of the wall.  Rap from the anchors or continue on P2 of the Bypass.

content.description: This superb climb starts at the arching handcrack to the right of the Bypass.  Follow it up to the roof.  Exit the left side of the roof, then make an airy step back right over the roof and traverse to the next roof (watch the drag).  Fire the crux to the belay station. Rap with a single 60m or continue up the Bypass.
content.location: Located on the large ledge system on the left side of the wall, just right of the Bypass.  See the Bypass beta photo for details.

content.description:
P1- follow the wide crack up the slab until you hit an imposing corner.  Make a large, airy step around to the right-side of the corner (above a roof) and delicately traverse over to the next roof. Pull the second roof and belay at bolted station.

P2- follow the right slanting crack thru a runnel till you hit a vertical dike.  Follow to the top.  Rap down Tumbledown with 2 ropes.
content.location: Scramble up to a large ledge system on the left side of the wall.  Begin just around the main corner of the wall near a bunch of boulders.
